Text: Cynegeirus, also spelled Cynaegeirus or Cynegirus (Greek: Κυνέγειρος or Κυναίγειρος "Kynegeiros" or "Kynaigeiros"; died 490 BC) was an ancient Greek hero of Athens and had three siblings.
Triplets:<Cynegeirus
1:
--------------------
Text: Cynaegirus:  His two brothers were the playwright Aeschylus and Ameinias, hero of the battle of Salamis, while his sister was Philopatho (Greek: Φιλοπαθώ ), the mother of the Athenian tragic poet Philokles.
Triplets:<Cynaegirus
2:
--------------------
Text: Cynaegirus:  He was the son of Euphorion (Greek: Ευφορίωνας ) from Eleusis and member of the Eupatridae, the ancient nobility of Attica.

Triplets:<Cynaegirus
